content.description: Another good beginner lead with fun moves and bolts where you want them.  An easy, low-angle start leads to steeper moves with big holds through a 5.7/5.8 crux.
content.location: The 3rd route from the right on Hueco Wall (the cliff right of Dirt Wall).

content.description: Steep, juggy and fun climbing past 4 bolts.  The hardest part is about 2/3 of the way up at a bulge.
content.location: This is the 2nd from the left of the 5 sport climbs on Hueco Wall (the wall right of Dirt Wall).  It begins just right of the big yucca-looking bush.

content.description: Follow the bolts through a steep section with some big Huecos on the right side of Hueco Wall.  This is an excellent beginner climb and would make for a good first lead.
content.location: This is the 2nd from the right sport climb on Hueco Wall (which is right of Dirt Wall).

content.description: A steep bouldery start that can be tough for a 5.9 climber begins the climb. Above, it's never tougher than 5.8 jughauling.
content.location: The left most route on Hueco Wall (the wall right of Dirt Wall).  Starts left of a big bush.

climbs.name: Gumby and Pokey
climbs.fa: Kris Hardy, Doni Hardy, Vaino Kodas

content.description:
Start to the left of the first bolt.  An easy climb, just a little harder than Mr. Jibbers. 

  Bolted and FA on November 22nd, 2014.
content.protection: 4 fixed bolts to two bolted chain anchors.  No quick-links at the anchors.  Bolts are painted brown.
content.location: To the right of Mr. Jibbers.  As of December 2014, this is the right-most route on the Hueco Wall.

content.description:
This small wall contains four sport climbs of moderate difficulty.  While this wall is right past Dirt Wall, the different rock angle and features allow much more moderate grades.  There is still some loose rock on some of the climbs so use caution. 

  Gets morning shade, then direct sun.  Doesn't get shade for as long as Dirt Wall.
